Retrieved: 2012-04-16.</ref> is a village in [[County Mayo]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]. It is located on the [[R300 road (Ireland)|R300 road]] where the Glensaul River flows into [[Lough Mask]]. It has a population of about 1,000 people within the largest [[Gaeltacht]] ([[Irish language|Irish]] speaking) region in Ireland.<ref>http://tourmakeady.weebly.com/history-of-tourmakeady.html</ref> Part of Toormakeady was originally in neighbouring [[County Galway]], but was placed under the administration of County Mayo in 1898. On 3 May 1921, during the [[Irish War of Independence]] the [[Irish Republican Army]] south Mayo [[flying column]] of around 30 men together with a small number of men from east Mayo mounted an ambush at Toormakeady. From the time of the [[Great Famine (Ireland)|Great Famine]] of the mid-1840s onwards, the village has experienced a high level of emigration. Many descendants of emigrants return every year to find their roots. The genealogical records for this area have been computerised at the South Mayo Family Research Centre in nearby [[Ballinrobe]] to make the task of tracing roots easier. The English actor [[Robert Shaw (British actor)|Robert Shaw]], best known for his work in ''[[From Russia With Love (film)| From Russia, With Love]]'', ''[[Jaws (film)|Jaws]]'' and ''[[The Sting]]'', lived in Drimbawn House,<ref>http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2008/0811/1218232689497.html</ref> Toormakeady until his death in 1978. ==See also== * [[Connacht Irish]] * [[List of towns and villages in the Republic of Ireland]] * [[Thomas Plunket, 2nd Baron Plunket]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat|Toormakeady}} *[http://www.tourmakeady.com/ Toormakeady Web Site] *[http://tourmakeady.weebly.com/ Toormakeady Community Web Site] *[http://www.podcasts.ie/2010/03/mayos-heritage-week-5/ Audio podcast] excerpt from Michael John Casey's Heritage Tour of Toormakeady.
